body_html:
@schmiflo adding hdrs = glob(["user_ops/**/*.h"]) to the //tensorflow/core:user_ops_op_lib BUILD rule might fix your custom ops problem (Update: actually that looks like something else, but this should fix an undeclared inclusion(s) error if you use custom headers.)

@untom I got a similar "undeclared inclusion(s)" error with bazel 0.1.3, but downgrading to a precompiled 0.1.1 seemed to fix the problem (note, however, that I am not trying to build the pip package).

@untom I got a similar "undeclared inclusion(s)" error with bazel 0.1.3, but downgrading to a precompiled 0.1.1 seemed to fix the problem (note, however, that I am not trying to build the pip package).
body:
@schmiflo adding hdrs = glob(["user_ops/**/*.h"]) to the //tensorflow/core:user_ops_op_lib BUILD rule might fix your custom ops problem (Update: actually that looks like something else, but this should fix an undeclared inclusion(s) error if you use custom headers.)

@untom I got a similar "undeclared inclusion(s)" error with bazel 0.1.3, but downgrading to a precompiled 0.1.1 seemed to fix the problem (note, however, that I am not trying to build the pip package).
